rows.title: Water
rows.description: * Water sanitation is the way of cleaning and purifying water so that it's safe for use.                                                                                              * An example of water sanitation is filtering which removes impurities (dirt) in water.

rows.title: Waste Managment
rows.description: Waste management is a process that combines all the activities necessary for managing waste â€“ collection of garbage, transportation, and disposal of trash. Its primary purpose is to lessen the waste of unusable materials and avoid potential environmental and health risks.

rows.title: Deworming
rows.description: Deworming is the process of expelling intestinal worms or parasitic worms from the body by administering an anthelmintic medicine/drug.

rows.title: Menstrual Hygiene
rows.description: The onset of menstruation means a new phase and new vulnerabilities in the lives of adolescents.
